## bindEventWithChecks\_() function

> Warning: This API is now obsolete.
> 
> Use Blockly.browserEvents.conditionalBind(). (December 2021)
> 

Bind an event handler that can be ignored if it is not part of the active touch stream. Use this for events that either start or continue a multi-part gesture (e.g. mousedown or mousemove, which may be part of a drag or click).

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare function bindEventWithChecks_(node: EventTarget, name: string, thisObject: Object | null, func: Function, opt_noCaptureIdentifier?: boolean, opt_noPreventDefault?: boolean): browserEvents.Data;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  node | EventTarget | Node upon which to listen. |
|  name | string | Event name to listen to (e.g. 'mousedown'). |
|  thisObject | Object \| null | The value of 'this' in the function. |
|  func | Function | Function to call when event is triggered. |
|  opt\_noCaptureIdentifier | boolean | <i>(Optional)</i> True if triggering on this event should not block execution of other event handlers on this touch or other simultaneous touches. False by default. |
|  opt\_noPreventDefault | boolean | <i>(Optional)</i> True if triggering on this event should prevent the default handler. False by default. If opt\_noPreventDefault is provided, opt\_noCaptureIdentifier must also be provided.  Opaque data that can be passed to unbindEvent\_. |

<b>Returns:</b>

browserEvents.Data
